title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://www.contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

title: CRAN incoming dashboard
text: package stored different folder depending current state review process. exact meaning folder detailed articles R Journal 2018 2019, updated 2019 mailing list post (confirmed 2022): inspect: package awaiting manual inspection CRAN team, probably automated tests found problem likely false positive newbies: specific queue manual inspection first-time CRAN submissions. pending: CRAN team member closer inspection needs time. human: package assigned specific CRAN member (initials indicated subfolder) inspection. waiting: CRAN team waiting answer , e.g. issues present CRAN automatically check , maintainer changes (check e-mail …) pretest: CRAN maintainers restarted automated tests package see whether issue fixed action still present. archive: package rejected CRAN pass checks cleanly problems likely false positives. recheck: package passed basic checks. CRAN packages depend (“reverse dependencies”), reverse-dependency-checking step underway see update broken anything downstream. publish: ’re set! package passed review process soon available CRAN. information (approximately) summarised following diagram Hadley Wickham, available cran-stages Github repository:

title: Downloads history — download_history

title: Downloads history — download_history
text: `data.frame` columns: - `package`: package name - `version`: package submitted version - `snapshot_time`: time cransays snapshot, `"Europe/Vienna"` timezone, , CRAN servers. - `folder`: folder submitted package stored time snapshot - `subfolder`: subfolder submitted package stored time snapshot - `submission_time`: time package submitted CRAN, `"Europe/Vienna"` timezone, CRAN servers

title: Downloads history — download_history
